messages.message: In the database there is an expiration on tokens. But that’s never been plumbed through to the public APIs/UI. So by default, all tokens have “infinite” life. You just invalidate by refreshing it.
Makes sense. If I was going to open a “new feature” request around tokens, what project should I put that in?

Two tickets actually:

1. Ability to generate tokens with a predetermined, customer-determined lifetime
2. Ability to have two tokens valid at a time, to help with transitioning the apps consuming our API from one token to another without downtime
infra with the account-service component would be great
unfortunately that second one is not going to be easily doable without a db schema change
Hey, I just make the unreasonable requests. I don’t want to have to think about all the work required to actually _do_ them! :sweat_smile:
